title: CR60011: Cryofuel Systems - Quick Facts
text:
CR60011
Course name | CRYOFUEL SYSTEMS
Offered by | Cryogenic Engineering
Credits | 4
L-T-P | 3-1-0
Previous Year Grade Distribution
{{{grades}}}
Semester | {{{semester}}}

title: Syllabus mentioned in ERP
text: Properties of Hydrocarbon Mixtures-equations of state, The Law of Corresponding States, transport properties. Liquefied Petroleum Gas - properties, production and storage. Natural Gas-composition, source and pretreatment. Liquefaction of natural gas - simple cascade, mixed refrigerant and turbine expansion cycles, Ocean transport of LNG membrane and self-supporting tanks. Storage of LNG. Applications of NG and LNG and safety aspects; Hydrogen - properties, production and pretreatment - Liquefaction of hydrogen - Linde, Claude and helium - hydrogen condensing cycles, Ortho-para conversion. Storage and handling of liquefied hydrogen - applications of hydrogen, and its safety.
